blocks.name: distop
blocks.content: The discrete topology on a set ` A ` . Part of Example 2 in [Munkres] p. 77. (Contributed by FL, 17-Jul-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm distop(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cpw(c0), ctop))
} = {
  mpbir2and(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cpw(c0), ctop), wal(hs0, wi(wss(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0)))), wral(hs0, cpw(c0), wral(hs1, cpw(c0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0)))))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wal(hs0, wi(wss(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0)))))
  ax-gen(hs0, wi(wss(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0))))
  sylibr(wss(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0)), wss(cuni(cv(hs0)), c0))
  syl6sseq(cuni(cv(hs0)), c0, cuni(cpw(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  uniss(cv(hs0), cpw(c0))
  unipw(c0)
  elpw(cuni(cv(hs0)), c0)
  vuniex(hs0)
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wral(hs0, cpw(c0), wral(hs1, cpw(c0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0)))))
  rgen(hs0, cpw(c0), wral(hs1, cpw(c0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0))))
  ralrimiv(hs1, cpw(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0)))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wi(wcel(cv(hs1), cpw(c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0))), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  selpw(hs0, c0)
  com12(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), cpw(c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0)))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs1), cpw(c0)), wi(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0))), wss(cv(hs1), c0))
  selpw(hs1, c0)
  syl6ibr(wss(cv(hs1), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0)), wss(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0))
  a1i(wss(cv(hs1), c0), wi(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)))
  ssinss1(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))
  elpw(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)
  inex2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  vex(hs1)
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(cpw(c0), ctop), wa(wal(hs0, wi(wss(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0)))), wral(hs0, cpw(c0), wral(hs1, cpw(c0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpw(c0)))))), wcel(cpw(c0), universe))
  pwexg(c0, c1)
  istopg(hs0, hs1, cpw(c0), universe)
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(cpw(c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm distop(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí P(c0)‚àà Top)
} = {
  mpbir2and(c0 ‚àà c1, P(c0)‚àà Top, ‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚äÜ P(c0)‚Üí ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚àà P(c0))), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà P(c0), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà P(c0),(hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0))))
  a1i(c0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚äÜ P(c0)‚Üí ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚àà P(c0))))
  ax-gen(hs0, (hs0 ‚äÜ P(c0)‚Üí ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚àà P(c0)))
  sylibr(hs0 ‚äÜ P(c0), ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚àà P(c0), ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  syl6sseq(‚ãÉ hs0, c0, ‚ãÉ P(c0), hs0 ‚äÜ P(c0))
  uniss(hs0, P(c0))
  unipw(c0)
  elpw(‚ãÉ hs0, c0)
  vuniex(hs0)
  a1i(c0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà P(c0), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà P(c0),(hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0))))
  rgen(hs0, P(c0), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà P(c0),(hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0)))
  ralrimiv(hs1, P(c0), hs0 ‚àà P(c0), (hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0))
  sylbi(hs0 ‚àà P(c0), (hs1 ‚àà P(c0)‚Üí(hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0)), hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  selpw(hs0, c0)
  com12(hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs1 ‚àà P(c0), (hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0))
  sylbi(hs1 ‚àà P(c0), (hs0 ‚äÜ c0 ‚Üí(hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0)), hs1 ‚äÜ c0)
  selpw(hs1, c0)
  syl6ibr(hs1 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚äÜ c0, (hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0), (hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚äÜ c0)
  a1i(hs1 ‚äÜ c0, (hs0 ‚äÜ c0 ‚Üí(hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚äÜ c0))
  ssinss1(hs0, c0, hs1)
  elpw((hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1), c0)
  inex2(hs0, hs1)
  vex(hs1)
  syl(c0 ‚àà c1, (P(c0)‚àà Top ‚Üî(‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚äÜ P(c0)‚Üí ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚àà P(c0)))‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà P(c0), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà P(c0),(hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà P(c0))))), P(c0)‚àà ùïå)
  pwexg(c0, c1)
  istopg(hs0, hs1, P(c0), universe)
  diff.hs1.w(hs0 ‚àà P(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(P(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(P(c0))
}

blocks.name: topnex
blocks.content: The class of all topologies is a proper class. The proof uses discrete topologies and ~ pwnex ; an alternate proof uses indiscrete topologies (see ~ indistop ) and the analogue of ~ pwnex with pairs ` { (/) , x } ` instead of power sets ` ~P x ` (that analogue is also a consequence of ~ abnex ). (Contributed by BJ, 2-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm topnex() {
  |- wnel(ctop, universe)
} = {
  nelir(ctop, universe)
  mto(wcel(ctop, universe), wcel(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1))))), universe))
  neli(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1))))), universe)
  pwnex(hs0, hs1)
  mpan(wcel(ctop, universe), wcel(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1))))), universe), wss(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1))))), ctop))
  abssi(hs0, ctop, wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1)))))
  exlimiv(hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs0), ctop))
  mpbiri(wceq(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs0), ctop), wcel(cpw(cv(hs1)), ctop))
  elv(hs1, wcel(cpw(cv(hs1)), ctop))
  distop(cv(hs1), universe)
  eleq1(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1)), ctop)
  ssexg(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(hs1))))), ctop, universe)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cv(hs0), ctop))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm topnex() {
  ‚ä¢ Top ‚àâ ùïå
} = {
  nelir(ctop, universe)
  mto(Top ‚àà ùïå, { hs0 | ‚àÉ(hs1, hs0 = P(hs1))} ‚àà ùïå)
  neli({ hs0 | ‚àÉ(hs1, hs0 = P(hs1))}, universe)
  pwnex(hs0, hs1)
  mpan(Top ‚àà ùïå, { hs0 | ‚àÉ(hs1, hs0 = P(hs1))} ‚àà ùïå, { hs0 | ‚àÉ(hs1, hs0 = P(hs1))} ‚äÜ Top)
  abssi(hs0, ctop, ‚àÉ(hs1, hs0 = P(hs1)))
  exlimiv(hs1, hs0 = P(hs1), hs0 ‚àà Top)
  mpbiri(hs0 = P(hs1), hs0 ‚àà Top, P(hs1)‚àà Top)
  elv(hs1, P(hs1)‚àà Top)
  distop(hs1, universe)
  eleq1(hs0, P(hs1), ctop)
  ssexg({ hs0 | ‚àÉ(hs1, hs0 = P(hs1))}, ctop, universe)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs1.w(hs0 ‚àà Top)
}

blocks.name: sn0topon
blocks.content: The singleton of the empty set is a topology on the empty set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: sn0top
blocks.content: The singleton of the empty set is a topology. (Contributed by Stefan Allan, 3-Mar-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: indislem
blocks.content: A lemma to eliminate some sethood hypotheses when dealing with the indiscrete topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Aug-2015.)

blocks.content: The indiscrete topology on a set ` A ` . Part of Example 2 in [Munkres] p. 77. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2015.)

  mpbir2and(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cpr(emptycls, c0), ctop), wal(hs0, wi(wss(cv(hs0), cpr(emptycls, c0)), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpr(emptycls, c0)))), wral(hs0, cpr(emptycls, c0), wral(hs1, cpr(emptycls, c0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0)))))

  jaod(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), csn(emptycls)), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpr(emptycls, c0)))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpr(emptycls, c0))))

  unieq(cv(hs0), csn(c0))

  eqeltrd(cuni(cv(hs0)), cpr(emptycls, c0), c0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), cpr(emptycls, c0))))
  sylan9eqr(cuni(cv(hs0)), c0, cuni(cpr(emptycls, c0)), wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), cpr(emptycls, c0)))
  unieq(cv(hs0), cpr(emptycls, c0))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), cpr(emptycls, c0)), wcel(c0, cpr(emptycls, c0)))
  ralrimiv(hs0, cpr(emptycls, c0), wcel(c0, c1), wral(hs1, cpr(emptycls, c0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0))))

  syl5bi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), cpr(emptycls, c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0)), wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), c0)))

  syl6eqel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0), emptycls, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)))
  syl6eq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), emptycls, cin(cv(hs0), emptycls), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)))
  ineq2d(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), emptycls, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0))))
  syl6eqel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0), emptycls, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)))
  syl6eq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), emptycls, cin(cv(hs0), emptycls), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)))
  ineq2d(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), emptycls, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls))
  in0(cv(hs0))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wa(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0))))
  syl6eqel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0), emptycls, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), c0)))
  syl6eq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), emptycls, cin(emptycls, cv(hs1)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), c0)))
  ineq1d(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), emptycls, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), c0)))
  simpl(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  0in(cv(hs1))
  prid1(emptycls, c0)
  ex(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0)))
  eqeltrd(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cpr(emptycls, c0), c0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))))
  syl6eq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0, cin(c0, c0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0)), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cin(c0, c0)))
  ineq12(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1), c0)

  prid2g(c0, c1, emptycls)

  diff.hs1.c(cpr(emptycls, c0))

thm indistopon(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí { ‚àÖ, c0 } ‚àà(TopOn ` c0))
} = {
  sylanbrc(c0 ‚àà c1, { ‚àÖ, c0 } ‚àà(TopOn ` c0), { ‚àÖ, c0 } ‚àà Top, c0 = ‚ãÉ { ‚àÖ, c0 })
  mpbir2and(c0 ‚àà c1, { ‚àÖ, c0 } ‚àà Top, ‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚äÜ { ‚àÖ, c0 } ‚Üí ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚àà { ‚àÖ, c0 })), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà { ‚àÖ, c0 }, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà { ‚àÖ, c0 },(hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚àà { ‚àÖ, c0 })))
  alrimiv(hs0, c0 ‚àà c1, (hs0 ‚äÜ { ‚àÖ, c0 } ‚Üí ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚àà { ‚àÖ, c0 }))

blocks.name: pptbas
blocks.content: The particular point topology is generated by a basis consisting of pairs ` { x , P } ` for each ` x e. A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ‚àà P(c0)|(c2 ‚àà s0 ‚Üí s0 = c0)})
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.wi.s(s0, c2 ‚àà c0, c0 = c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c2, c0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, c0, c0)
}

blocks.name: indistpsx
blocks.content: The indiscrete topology on a set ` A ` expressed as a topological space, using explicit structure component references. Compare with ~ indistps and ~ indistps2 . The advantage of this version is that the actual function for the structure is evident, and ~ df-ndx is not needed, nor any other special definition outside of basic set theory. The disadvantage is that if the indices of the component definitions ~ df-base and ~ df-tset are changed in the future, this theorem will also have to be changed. Note: This theorem has hard-coded structure indices for demonstration purposes. It is not intended for general use; use ~ indistps instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by FL, 19-Jul-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm indistpsx(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wcel(c0, ctps)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
  -| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(nat1, c1), cop(nat9, cpr(emptycls, c1))))
} = {
  eltpsi(c0, c1, cpr(emptycls, c1))
  eqtr4i(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cts, cnx), cpr(emptycls, c1))), cpr(cop(nat1, c1), cop(nat9, cpr(emptycls, c1))))
  preq12i(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cts, cnx), cpr(emptycls, c1)), cop(nat1, c1), cop(nat9, cpr(emptycls, c1)))
  opeq1i(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1, nat1)
  basendx()
  opeq1i(cfv(cts, cnx), cpr(emptycls, c1), nat9)
  tsetndx()
  toponunii(c1, cpr(emptycls, c1))
  ax-mp(wcel(cpr(emptycls, c1), cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c1, universe))
  indistopon(c1, universe)
  indistop(c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm indistpsx(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ c0 ‚àà TopSp
  ‚ä£ c1 ‚àà ùïå
  ‚ä£ c0 = { < 1, c1 >, < 9, { ‚àÖ, c1 } > }
} = {
  eltpsi(c0, c1, { ‚àÖ, c1 })
  eqtr4i(c0, { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(TopSet ` ndx), { ‚àÖ, c1 } > }, { < 1, c1 >, < 9, { ‚àÖ, c1 } > })
  preq12i(<(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(TopSet ` ndx), { ‚àÖ, c1 } >, < 1, c1 >, < 9, { ‚àÖ, c1 } >)
  opeq1i((Base ` ndx), c1, nat1)
  basendx()
  opeq1i((TopSet ` ndx), { ‚àÖ, c1 }, nat9)
  tsetndx()
  toponunii(c1, { ‚àÖ, c1 })
  ax-mp({ ‚àÖ, c1 } ‚àà(TopOn ` c1), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  indistopon(c1, universe)
  indistop(c1)
}

blocks.name: indistps
blocks.content: The indiscrete topology on a set ` A ` expressed as a topological space, using implicit structure indices. The advantage of this version over ~ indistpsx is that it is independent of the indices of the component definitions ~ df-base and ~ df-tset , and if they are changed in the future, this theorem will not be affected. The advantage over ~ indistps2 is that it is easy to eliminate the hypotheses with ~ eqid and ~ vtoclg to result in a closed theorem. Theorems ~ indistpsALT and ~ indistps2ALT show that the two forms can be derived from each other. (Contributed by FL, 19-Jul-2006.)

blocks.name: indistps2
blocks.content: The indiscrete topology on a set ` A ` expressed as a topological space, using direct component assignments. Compare with ~ indistps . The advantage of this version is that it is the shortest to state and easiest to work with in most situations. Theorems ~ indistpsALT and ~ indistps2ALT show that the two forms can be derived from each other. (Contributed by NM, 24-Oct-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm indistps2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wcel(c0, ctps)
  -| wceq(cfv(cbs, c0), c1)
  -| wceq(cfv(ctopn, c0), cpr(emptycls, c1))
} = {
  istpsi(c0, c1, cpr(emptycls, c1))
  3eqtrri(c1, cuni(cpr(emptycls, c1)), cun(emptycls, c1), cun(c1, emptycls))
  unipr(emptycls, c1)
  0ex()
  eqeltrri(c1, universe, cfv(cbs, c0))
  fvex(cbs, c0)
  uncom(emptycls, c1)
  un0(c1)
  indistop(c1)
}

blocks.name: indistpsALT
blocks.content: The indiscrete topology on a set ` A ` expressed as a topological space. Here we show how to derive the structural version ~ indistps from the direct component assignment version ~ indistps2 . (Contributed by NM, 24-Oct-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm indistpsALT(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wcel(c0, ctps)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
  -| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cts, cnx), cpr(emptycls, c1))))
} = {
  mp2b(wcel(c0, ctps), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cpr(emptycls, c1), cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  indistopon(c1, universe)
  tsettps(cpr(emptycls, c1), c1, c0)
  ax-mp(wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c1, universe))
  2strbas(c1, universe, c0, cts, cpr(emptycls, c1), nat9)
  ax-mp(wceq(cpr(emptycls, c1), cfv(cts, c0)), wcel(cpr(emptycls, c1), universe))
  prex(emptycls, c1)
  2strop(cpr(emptycls, c1), universe, cts, c0, c1, nat9)
  df-tset()
  1lt9()
  9nn()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm indistpsALT(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ c0 ‚àà TopSp
  ‚ä£ c1 ‚àà ùïå
  ‚ä£ c0 = { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(TopSet ` ndx), { ‚àÖ, c1 } > }
} = {
  mp2b(c0 ‚àà TopSp, c1 ‚àà ùïå, { ‚àÖ, c1 } ‚àà(TopOn ` c1))
  indistopon(c1, universe)
  tsettps({ ‚àÖ, c1 }, c1, c0)
  ax-mp(c1 =(Base ` c0), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  2strbas(c1, universe, c0, cts, { ‚àÖ, c1 }, nat9)
  ax-mp({ ‚àÖ, c1 } =(TopSet ` c0), { ‚àÖ, c1 } ‚àà ùïå)
  prex(emptycls, c1)
  2strop({ ‚àÖ, c1 }, universe, cts, c0, c1, nat9)
  df-tset()
  1lt9()
  9nn()
}

blocks.name: indistps2ALT
blocks.content: The indiscrete topology on a set ` A ` expressed as a topological space, using direct component assignments. Here we show how to derive the direct component assignment version ~ indistps2 from the structural version ~ indistps . (Contributed by NM, 24-Oct-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm indistps2ALT(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wcel(c0, ctps)
  -| wceq(cfv(cbs, c0), c1)
  -| wceq(cfv(ctopn, c0), cpr(emptycls, c1))
} = {
  mpbir(wcel(c0, ctps), wcel(cpr(emptycls, c1), cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  ax-mp(wcel(cpr(emptycls, c1), cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c1, universe))
  eqeltrri(c1, universe, cfv(cbs, c0))
  fvex(cbs, c0)
  indistopon(c1, universe)
  istps(c0, cpr(emptycls, c1), c1)
  eqcomi(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqcomi(cpr(emptycls, c1), cfv(ctopn, c0))
}

blocks.name: distps
blocks.content: The discrete topology on a set ` A ` expressed as a topological space. (Contributed by FL, 20-Aug-2006.)
